title: Noj tutorials
text:
This is part of the Scicloj Clojure Data Scrapbook.

1 Preface
Noj (short for Scinojure) is an opinionated way to use the emerging Clojure data stack. It collects a few of the relevant libraries together and addes some layers of composition on top of them.

source: projects/noj/notebooks/index.clj

title: 2  Machine learning - DRAFT
text:
2.1 Linear regression
We will explore the Iris dataset:
_unnamed [5 5]:
A Metamorph pipeline for linear regression:
Training and evaluating the pipeline on various subsets:
Printing one of the trained models (note that the Smile regression model is recognized by Kindly and printed correctly):

title: 2  Machine learning - DRAFT
text:
(tc/head datasets/iris)

(def additive-pipeline
  (ml/pipeline
   (mm/set-inference-target :sepal-length)
   (mm/drop-columns [:species])
   {:metamorph/id :model}
   (mm/model {:model-type :smile.regression/ordinary-least-square})))



(def evaluations
  (ml/evaluate-pipelines
   [additive-pipeline]
   (ds/split->seq datasets/iris :holdout)
   ml/rmse
   :loss
   {:other-metrices [{:name :r2
                      :metric-fn fastmath.stats/r2-determination}]}))



(-> evaluations
    flatten
    first
    :fit-ctx
    :model
    ml/thaw-model)


Linear Model:

Residuals:
       Min          1Q      Median          3Q         Max
   -0.7698     -0.2213      0.0137      0.2288      0.8729

Coefficients:
                  Estimate Std. Error    t value   Pr(>|t|)
Intercept           1.6390     0.3162     5.1840     0.0000 ***
sepal-width         0.7174     0.0830     8.6439     0.0000 ***
petal-length        0.7632     0.0750    10.1800     0.0000 ***
petal-width        -0.7042     0.1700    -4.1421     0.0001 ***
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Significance codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

Residual standard error: 0.3235 on 96 degrees of freedom
Multiple R-squared: 0.8505,    Adjusted R-squared: 0.8458
F-statistic: 182.0086 on 4 and 96 DF,  p-value: 1.772e-39
